blocklist.displayName: Fighter (Arcane Archer) 7: Additional Arcane Shot Option

entries.name: Special
entries: If you miss an attack with the boomerang and there is enough space around for it to return to you, it returns to you at the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you hit a creature that is at most one size category larger than you with a harpoon, you can force it to succeed on a strength contest against you or be pulled up to 20 feet towards you.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you are attacked with a sword or sword-like weapon while you use the sword breaker, you gain a +1 bonus to your ac for that attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: While sheathed, this weapon looks like a normal walking cane.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you attack with a meteor hammer as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage on a hit and can't benefit from the weapons reach property.

entries.name: Special
entries: Once per turn, immediatly after you make an attack with the fan, or as a bonus action on your turn, you can fold or unfold the fan. When you do so, you gain a +1 to the next attack roll you make until the end of your next turn. In its folded state, the fan deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage instead of {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a bolas is knocked prone and can't stand up until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on creatures that are formless, don't need legs to move, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the bolas (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the bolas.

entries.name: Special
entries: As a bonus action, you can hide behind the shield to gain full cover until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|BTB|bucklers} and {@item sword cane|BTB|sword canes}.

classFeature.name: Countercharm
entries: {@i 6th-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Countercharm feature

Starting at 6th level, your magnificent presence disrupts mind-influencing effects. You and each creatue of your choice within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or charmed. You must be consious grant this bonusand a creature must be able to hear or see you to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with one exotic weapon of your choice.

classFeature.name: Step of The Wind
entries: {@i 2nd-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Step of the Wind feature}

As a bonus action, you can take the Disengage or Dash action and your jump distance is doubled for the turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest.
Alternatively, you can expend 1 ki point to use this feature.

classFeature.name: Perfected Self
entries: {@i 20th-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}, which replaces the Perfected Self feature
At 20th level, you become a paragon of self control. Your Dexterity and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

classFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level rogue {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|BTB|bucklers}, {@item scimitar||scimitars} and {@item sword cane|BTB|sword canes}.

items: A frozen creature is incapacitated and can't move or speak.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
The creature has vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.
If the creature takes any amount of fire damage the condition ends on it.

feat.name: Rover
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet, and you gain a climbing speed and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

feat.name: Rune Knight Initiate
entries: You learned to carve runes imbued with magic. As a result, you learn one rune of your choice from among the runes available to rune knights.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a objects equal and inscribe the rune onto the objects. To be eligible, an object must be a weapon, a suit of armor, a shield, a piece of jewelry, or something else you can wear or hold in a hand. Your rune remains on an object until you finish a long rest.
If a rune requires a saving throw, your Rune Magic save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's rune with another one available to the rune knight.

feat.name: Barrage
entries: You have learned to throw multiple projectiles with one swift motion.

As an action, you can throw daggers or darts in a 20-foot cone. When you do so, a number of creature of your choice within that area equal to the number of weapons you throw must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or take the thrown weapons damage. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it takes an extra {@damage 1d8} damage of the weapon's type.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

feat.name: Dash Attack
entries: You have learned to use the momentum of your movement for your attacks.
Immediatly after you take the dash action, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
In addition, if you move at least 10 feet straight towards a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} damage of the weapon's type.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

feat.name: Shield Bash

prerequisite.other: Proficiency with any kind of shield

entries: You have learned to use your shield in more offensive ways.

When a creature misses you with a melee attack while you are wielding a shield, you can use your reaction and bash the creature with your shield. It takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and the next attack roll against the creature is made with advantage.
If you are wielding a spiked shield, you deal the damage of the shield instead of the bludgeoning damage.

feat.name: Spin Attack
entries: You have learned to use the weight of your weapon for your advantage.

As an action, while wielding a greatsword or greataxe, you can perform a spin attack. When you do so, make a melee weapon attack against each creature within 5 feet of you. A creature hit by your attack has to succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone} by the attack. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapon's type.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

item.name: +1 Arcane Bracers
entries: This bracers are made of pure silver engraved with elvish runes glowing in a faint blue. While wearing these bracers you gain a +1 bonus to the damage and DC of your arcane shots.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain two uses of your Arcane Shot feature. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +1 Battle Standard of Power
entries: While you hold this banner, you and all allied creatures within 60 feet of you gain a +1 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls.

item.name: +1 Brass Bracelet
entries: While wearing this bracelet, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage roll made of your unarmed strikes.

item.name: +1 Feral Kilt
entries: This kilt is made from fur of various apex predators. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +1 bonus to your rage damage and unarmored defense.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed towards a hostile creature.

item.name: +1 Gauntlets of Superiority
entries: This pair of masterfully crafted gauntlets is made of high quality steel. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +1 bonus to the damage and DC of your maneuvers.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain 2 superiority dice. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +2 Arcane Bracers
entries: This bracers are made of pure silver engraved with elvish runes glowing in a faint blue. While wearing these bracers you gain a +2 bonus to the damage and DC of your arcane shots.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain two uses of your Arcane Shot feature. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +2 Battle Standard of Power
entries: While you hold this banner, you and all allied creatures within 60 feet of you gain a +2 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls.

item.name: +2 Brass Bracelet
entries: While wearing this bracelet, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage roll made of your unarmed strikes.

item.name: +2 Feral Kilt
entries: This kilt is made from fur of various apex predators. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +2 bonus to your rage damage and unarmored defense.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed towards a hostile creature.

item.name: +2 Gauntlets of Superiority
entries: This pair of masterfully crafted gauntlets is made of high quality steel. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage and DC of your maneuvers.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain 2 superiority dice. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +3 Arcane Bracers
entries: This bracers are made of pure silver engraved with elvish runes glowing in a faint blue. While wearing these bracers you gain a +3 bonus to the damage and DC of your arcane shots.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain two uses of your Arcane Shot feature. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +3 Battle Standard of Power
entries: While you hold this banner, you and all allied creatures within 60 feet of you gain a +3 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls.

item.name: +3 Brass Bracelet
entries: While wearing this bracelet, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage roll made of your unarmed strikes.

item.name: +3 Feral Kilt
entries: This kilt is made from fur of various apex predators. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +3 bonus to your rage damage and unarmored defense.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed towards a hostile creature.

item.name: +3 Gauntlets of Superiority
entries: This pair of masterfully crafted gauntlets is made of high quality steel. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +3 bonus to the damage and DC of your maneuvers.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to regain 2 superiority dice. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Amulet of Warning
entries: While wearing this amulet, you can't be suprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The amulet magically awakens you if you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

item.name: Armor of Bilarro
entries: The gauntlets and bracers of this armor are made of coils of rusty iron bands.

While wearing the armor, you have advantage on grapple checks. In addition, you can increase the reach of your grapple by reducing your AC as the iron bands expend towards your target. When you do so, the reach for your grapple increases by 5 feet for each point you reduce your AC. Your AC stays reduced until your grapple ends.

item.name: Battle Standard of the Commander
entries: While you hold this banner, you can use a bonus action and choose one creature within 60 feet of you. That creature can make one melee or ranged weapon attack with its reaction, provided that it can see or hear you. After you use this item, roll a d6. If you roll a 4 or lower, you can't use the item again for 1 hour.

item.name: Battle Standard of Courage
entries: While you hold the banner, you and all allied creatures within 300 feet of you are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

item.name: Behir Splint
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain resistance to lightning damage.

item.name: Elemental Quiver
entries: This quiver flickers with elemental energies. It has space for 10 pieces of ammunition and any piece placed in it has a chance of absorbing some of the elemental energies of the quiver. After a piece of ammuntion has been within the quiver for at least one hour, roll a {@dice d6}. The ammunition turns into an elemental piece of ammunition as noted in the Elemental Quiver table.
Some elemental quivers only produce one kind of elemental ammunition.

item.name: Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 5-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Flask of Acid
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

item.name: Flask of Alchemist's Fire
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 fire damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Flask of Dry Ice
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} cold damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 5 feet until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the dry ice.

item.name: Flask of Greater Acid
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

item.name: Flask of Greater Alchemist's Fire
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Flask of Greater Dry Ice
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the dry ice.

item.name: Flask of Greater Holy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a fiend or undead, it takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the holy water.

item.name: Flask of Greater Unholy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a celestial, it takes {@damage 3d8} force damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the unholy water.

item.name: Flask of Holy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a fiend or undead, it takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 radiant damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the holy water.

item.name: Flask of Oil
entries: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.
On a hit, the target is covered in oil. The target is vunerable to fire damage until the oil dries (after 1 minute) or it takes any amount of fire damage.

You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 1 minute and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

item.name: Flask of Superior Acid
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

item.name: Flask of Superior Alchemist's Fire
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

item.name: Flask of Superior Holy Water

item.name: Flask of Supreme Acid
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 7d6} acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

item.name: Flask of Supreme Alchemist's Fire
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 7d6} fire damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to extinguish the flames.

If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d4} cold damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the dry ice.

item.name: Flask of Supreme Holy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. item.name: Flask of Supreme Unholy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a celestial, it takes {@damage 7d8} force damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 3d6} force damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the unholy water.

item.name: Flask of Unholy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a celestial, it takes {@damage 1d8} force damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 force damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the unholy water.

item.name: Greater Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 10-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Greater Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Master's Blindfold
entries: A singular eye is painted on this blindfold made of velvet. While you wear this blindfold over your eyes and attuned to it, you are {@condition blinded}, but you gain blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: As an action, you can throw the Smoke Bomb at point within 30 feet of you. The bomb then detonates. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

The bomb create a 15-foot-radius sphere of smoke centered on the point where it detonated. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

item.name: Superior Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 15-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Superior Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 15-foot radius must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Supreme Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 20-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Supreme Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 20-foot radius must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 5-foot radius must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Transdimensional Dagger
entries: This dagger seems to fade in and out of the ethereal plane in random intervals.

Immediatly after you threw the dagger, you can use a bonus action and teleport yourself to the dagger. When you do so, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space of the dagger and it reappears in your hand.

itemGroup.name: Flashstone (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item flashstone|BTB}}.

itemGroup.name: Flask of Acid (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item flask of acid|BTB}}.

itemGroup.name: Flask of Alchemist's Fire (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item flask of alchemist's fire|BTB}}.

itemGroup.name: Flask of Dry Ice (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item flask of dry ice|BTB}}.

itemGroup.name: Flask of Holy Water (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item flask of holy water|BTB}}.

itemGroup.name: Flask of Unholy Water (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item flask of unholy water|BTB}}.

itemGroup.name: Thunderstone (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item thunderstone|BTB}}.

entries.name: Armor Piercing
entries: When you attack a creature wearing medium or heavy armor, you gain a bonus to your attack roll equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

entries.name: Lunge
entries: Once per turn, when you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can increase your reach for that attack by 5 feet.

entries.name: Sweep
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to your Proficiency bonus. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

entries.name: Feint
entries: You can use a bonus action on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. You have advantage on your next attack roll this turn against that creature.

entries.name: Trip
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can attempt to knock the target down. If the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target prone.

entries.name: Push
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can attempt to drive the target back. If the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

entries.name: Brace
entries: When a creature you can see moves into the reach you have with this weapon, you can use your reaction to make one attack against the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Rune
entries: This rune overflows with the raw magical energy of eldritch giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you gain a bonus to all Intelligence (Arcana) checks and Intelligence (History) checks you make regarding magic or magic items equal to your proficiency bonus.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage from a spell, you can use your reaction to invoke this rune and give the creature resistance to that damage until the start of its next turn.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fog Rune
entries: This rune channels the innate stealthiness of fog giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by fog or mist.

In addition, you can invoke this rune as a bonus action covering you in a small cloud of mist. For 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it, you gain a +1 bonus to your armor class and you are lightly obscured.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fomorian Rune
entries: This rune bears the magic that once cursed the fomorian race. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated.

In addition, you can invoke this runes magic as a bonus action unleashing the fomorian curse onto one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become cursed with magical deformities for 1 minute or until you lose conentration (as if concentrating on a spell).

While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity. A cursed creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn ending the effect on a successful one.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Runt Rune
entries: This rune evokes the ferociousness of ettins. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you must make a saving throw against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned} or being knocked {@condition unconscious}, you can use your reaction to invoke this rune and give the creature advantage on the saving throw.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Flaming Arrow
entries: You enhance your arrow with fire magic. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage and it catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 1d10 fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
The fire damage increases to {@damage 4d6} and {@damage 2d10} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Brute
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 30 seconds
For the potions duration, you gain advantage on all melee weapon attacks that use strength. In addition, all attacks against you have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Bull's Eye
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

optionalfeature.name: Cold
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to fire damage. In addition, you don't suffer the effects of extrem heat.

optionalfeature.name: Day
entries: Toxicity: 2
Duration: 2 hours
For the potions duration, you gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Durable
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Ground
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Leach
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Regena
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, at the start of your turn, when you have at least 1 hit point left, but no more than half your hit point maximum, you regain hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Sight
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 2 hours
For the potions duration, you gain the effects of the {@spell see invisibly} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Steadfast

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 4
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you can't be {@condition stunned} or knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Stone

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Thick Hide
entries: Toxicity: 2
Duration: Instantaneous
You gain {@dice 1d4+4} temporary hit points.

entries.name: Higher Potency
entries: You gain additional 5 temporary hit points for each additional 2 points of toxicity you take.

optionalfeature.name: Warmth

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to cold damage. In addition, you don't suffer the effects of extrem cold.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 minute
Toxicity: 8
Duration: 1 minute
For the potions duration, you can take the {@action dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn. In addition, you gain a +2 to your AC and your speed increases by 10 feet.

A booming arrow is a magic weapon infused with thunder magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away is created and the creature and each creature with in 10 feet of it must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is deafend for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't deafend. A deafend creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.
Once a booming arrow deals damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A corroding arrow is a magic weapon infused with acid magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature has acid splashed over it; until someone takes an action to wipe of the acid, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} acid damage at the start of each of each of its turns. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the creature is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal hit by the arrow is disolved in 1 round.
Once a corroding arrow splashes a creature or an object, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A flame arrow is a magic weapon infused with fire magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. If you hit a flammable object with the arrow the object ignites.
Once a flame arrow ignites a creature or an object, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A frigid arrow is a magic weapon infused with ice magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, becoming {@condition frozen|BTB} until the end of its next turn on a failed save. If you hit water with the arrow, the water freezes in a 5-foot cube for 1 minute.
Once a frigid arrow forces a creature to make a saving throw, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A shocking arrow is a magic weapon infused with lightning magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, becoming {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn on a failed save. If the arrow hits an object that can conduct electricity, its effect extends to any creature touching the object.
Once a shocking arrow stuns a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.
This weapon returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack.

Melee weapons or ammunition made of cold iron are unusually effective against demons and fey. Attacks made with a cold iron weapon ignore resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks of any demon or fey hit by them.
The cold iron version of a melee weapon costs twice as much as the normal version.

Melee weapons or ammunition made of or coated with mithral are unusually effective against celestials. Attacks made with a mithral weapon ignore resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks of any celestial hit by them.
The mithral version of a melee weapon costs 300 gp more than the normal version, whether the weapon is made of the metal or coated with it.

Any shield with spikes implanted into its front is called a spiked shield. A spiked shield can be used as a martial melee weapon and deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. If you successfully shove a creature using the shield, the creature takes the damage of the shield in addition to the shoves normal effect.
The spiked version of a shield costs 10 gp more than the normal version.
Serrated blades are designed to inflict more gruesome wounds.

Any martial weapon dealing slashing damage except for whips can have serrated versions. When you hit a creature with a serrated blade, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC for this save equals 10 + your proficiency bonus.
On a failed save, a creature starts bleeding and takes {@damage 1d10} slashing damage at the start of each of its turns until it or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to quench the wound.
The serrated version of a weapon costs 15 gp more than the normal version.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Berserker
entries: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end—that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker's rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you strike fear in the hearts of your opponents. While raging, any creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be {@condition frightend} of you until your rage ends. A frightend creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.
If a creature succeeds on its saving throw, it is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzy
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you can enter a frenzy when you rage. When you do so, your melee weapon attacks deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus for the duration of your rage.

In addition, your bloodlust startles your opponents. As a bonus action, you can choose a creature frightend of you within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on another Wisdom saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 and it can't cast spells or concentrate on them until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns, you can use your bonus action to extend the duration of this effect on the creature until the end of your next turn.
When your rage ends, you suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Brute
entries: Some barbarians deem it unsatisfying to maul there foes with weapons. They think it is way better to simple bash in heads with their bare hands. Barbarians like this follow the Path of the Brute.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmed Attacks
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier on a hit.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you.

While raging, the damage die of your unarmed strikes increases to {@damage 1d8} and the damage you can deal to a grappled creature increses to {@damage 1d6}. In addition, you can make one grapple attempt as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: Starting at 6th level, while raging, your unarmed strikes and the damage you deal to a grappled creature count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Discombobulate
entries: At 10th level, you learned to discombobulate creatures with your unarmed strikes. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Choke Hold
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can try to strangle a creature grappled by you. Once per turn, as an attack on your turn while raging, you can force a creature grappled by you to make a Constitution saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. An {@condition unconscious} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: College of Dancing
entries: Members of the College of Dancing dedicated themselves to the art of dancing. They have learned to use there swift movements to inspire or dace others.

subclassFeature.name: Gracious Combat
entries: When you join the College of Dancing at 3rd level, you learn how to use certain weapons in a more graceful and swift way and your nimble movements allow you to doge attacks.

For you, quaterstaffs, sickles and spears gain the finesse property. Futhermore, while you are not wearing any armor or using a shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Dance
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your dance can inspire others.

As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to inspire a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The inspired creature can use its reaction to take the dodge action, move up to its movement speed or make a weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Rousing Dance
entries: At 6th level, you can use your action to start dancing. If you do so, choose one creature within 60 feet of you that you can see, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save the creature starts dancing wasting its next turn in the process. On your subsequent turns, you can use your bonus action to sustain the dance. A dancing creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn to end the effect early. The creature is immune if it can't see you or it is immune to being charmed.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master's Dance
entries: Starting at 14th level, whenever you use your Inspiring Dance feature, you gain the benefits of the dodge action.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Ferocity
entries: Druids of the Circle of Ferocity embrace the untaimed nature of the wilderness. These Druids channel primal magic through their own bodies to aid them in combat and turn them into beasts themself. They learned to grow bestial features and fight with the savagery of a wild animal when threatened.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your connection to the wilderness grants you access to certain spells. At 2nd level, you learn the primal savagery cantrip. At 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th level you gain access to the spells listed for that level in the Circle of Ferocity Spells table.

Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Ferocity
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain the ability to manifest a natural weapon. As an action, you can manifest your natural weapon and immediatly make one melee weapon attack with it and you can dismiss the weapon at any time (no action reqiured). You choose the weapons form when you gain this feature:

subclassFeature.name: Claws
entries: Each of your hands transforms into a claw, which you can use as a weapon if it's empty and deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a claw attack, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or start bleeding on a failure. A bleeding creature takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage at the start of of its turns until it or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to quench the wound.

subclassFeature.name: Fangs
entries: You grow venomous fangs in your mouth, which deal {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a fang attack, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC taking {@damage 2d10} poison damage and becoming poisoned for 1 minute on a failure. A poisoned creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn in order to end the effect early.

subclassFeature.name: Horns
entries: You grow a pair of pointy horns, which deal {@damage 1d10} piercing damage on a hit. If you move at least 15 feet straight towards a target an then hit it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tail
entries: You grow a lashing, clubbed tail, which deals {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage on a hit and has the reach property. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a tail attack, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw be pushed 10 feet back.

subclassFeature.name: Feral Form
entries: At second level, you learned to channel your ferocity with your magic. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your wild shape feature and tranform into your feral form. When you do so, you gain temporary hitpoints equal to twice your proficiency bonus and the following properties:

items: At the start of your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder damage (your choice when you enter your feral form).

entries: This form lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or you use a bonus action on your turn to end it.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach 6th level ({@damage 2d4}), 10th level ({@damage 3d4}) and 14th level ({@damage 4d4}) in the druid class.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Strikes
entries: Starting at 10th level, attacks with your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage while in your feral form.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Movement
entries: Starting at 14th level, your feral form grants you additional mobility. While in your feral form, you have a swimming speed or a climbing speed equal to your walking speed (your choice when you gain this feature). In addition, you can use a bonus action on your turn to expend one spell slot and increase your walking speed your walking speed by an amount equal to five times the spell's slot level.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Arcane Archers are some of the most elite warriors among the elves. They stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused arrows to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see "Arcane Shot Options" below).

Once per turn, when you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits a creature, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll. You can use this ability a number of time equal to your Intelligence modifier and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot Options
entries: The Arcane Shot feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
If an option requires a saving throw, your Arcane Shot save DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Volatile Shot
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can imbue your arrows with a large amount of magic. When you fire an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, you can shot an arrow infused with volatile magic.

When you do so, choose a point that you can see within 90 feet of you. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Arcane Shot save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 8d6} force damage or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Curving Shot
entries: At 15th level, you learn how to direct an errant arrow toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

subclassFeature.name: Disintegrating Shot
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can imbue your arrows with disintegration magic. As an action, you can shot an arrow in a 100 feet long 5 feet wide line. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Arcane Shot save DC or take {@damage 5d6 + 20} force damage. A creature is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points.
Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Strider
entries: Striders dedicate their life to hunting monsters and often sell their skills to townsfolk in need of a monster hunter. They augment their martial prowess with a special form of alchemy granting them abilities that mimic their prey. However, striders need to mutate their own bodies in order to endure the toxic potions they brew. Because of this, most common folk mistrust striders and most of their orders were driven to the fringes of society.

subclassFeature.name: Strider Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Strider Lore
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies. Furthermore, instead of sleeping for 8 hours, you can enter a deep meditational trance for 4 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemy
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to create {@filter strider potions|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF}. These potions are posionous to everyone that is not a strider.

entries.name: Preparing Formulae and using Mixtures
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you prepare a number of formulae equal to your Wisdom modifier + your fighter level divided by three. The formulae must be for potions. Preparing the formulae reflects four hours of brewing as part of your long rest, creating the mixtures you will use until your next long rest. As a bonus action on your turn, you can ingest a potion gaining its benefits, but increasing your toxicity level. If you use the same potion twice their effects don't stack.

entries.name: Toxicity Level and Toxixity Limit
entries: When you ingest a potion, your toxicity level increases by an amount noted in the formula. Your toxicity limit determines how high your toxicity level can get without suffering any drawbacks. When your toxicity level exceeds your toxicity limit, you take an amount of d10s of poison damage equal to the formulas toxicity cost ignoring resistances and immunities and your hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the poison damage you took. After you reduced your toxicity level below your toxicity limit, you can restore your hit point maximum using a greater restoration spell or similar magic. Additionally, you become poisoned until your toxicity level no longer exceeds your toxicity limit.When you finish a long rest, your toxicity level is reduced back to zero.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Oils
entries: At 7th level, you learned to create oils for your blades. As part of a short or long rest you can coat one melee weapon that deals slashing or piering damage with a special oil.

When you do so, choose one of type of creature: Abberations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, montrosities, plants or undead. When you hit a creature of the chosen type with the coated weapon, your attack counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage and the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier). On a failed save, the creature takes an extra {@damage 2d6} acid damage.
The weapon stays coated until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Special Ingredient
entries: At 10th level, you can add one of three special ingedients to your potions.

When you ingest a potion, you can choose one of the following effects to gain in addition to the potions normal effect. After you chose one ingredient, you can't choose that ingredient again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Giant's Toe
entries: You added a bit of a giant's toe to your potion giving you a +3 to all strength based damage rolls you make within the next minute.

entries.name: Troll Blood
entries: You added a bit of a troll's blood. At the start of your turn, when you are not incapacitated and have not taken acid or fire damage this round, you regain an amount of hit points equal to your fighter level divided by three (rounded down) for the next minute.

entries.name: Celestial Liver
entries: You added a bit of a celestial's liver reducing your toxicity level by an amount equal to your fighter level divided by three (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Eye
entries: At 15th level, your knowledge about monsters grants you insight into a creatures defenses. On your turn, you can choose a creature you can see and make a Wisdom (Insight) check to gain insight into either the targets hit points, vunerabilities or resistances and immunities. The DC for this check equals 10 + half the target's challenge rating (rounded down).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficieny bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Angel's Tear
entries: At 18th level, you learned how to create a special potion.
As an action, you can ingest that potion reducing your toxicity level to zero and ending all potion effects on you. After you used this feature, you can't use it again unit you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Jester
entries: Jesters are masters at hand-eye-coordination and use cunning to play their opponents like a fiddle. They constantly insult their enemies while chugging knives at them and dodging their attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Throws
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.
In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Taunt
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned to focus the anger of your opponents onto you. As an bonus action, you can start taunting a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. At the start of its turn, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus) or it can't target any creature other than you with an attack or harmful spell until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours. A creature immune if it can't see or hear you or if it's immune to being charmed.

subclassFeature.name: Juggling
entries: Starting at 9th level, as a bonus action, you can start juggling a number of weapons equal to your proficiency bonus until you end it as a bonus action. The weapons must have the thrown and light properties, both your hands must be free to use this feature and you can't use the dash action for the duration. When you use the attack action while juggling, you can make a number of attacks equal to your proficiency bonus divided by 2 (rounded down) throwing weapons you are juggling. Your juggling ends early when you have thrown all weapons you were juggling.

When you attack with one of the weapons, you can try to add a new weapon to your juggling. When you do so, make a Dexterity saving throw. The DC is equal to 12 + the number of weapons you are currently juggling. On a failed save, your jugging ends and all juggled weapons fall to the ground in front of you. On a successful save, the weapon is added to your juggling.

When you take damage while juggling, you have to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + half the damage taken + the number of juggled weapons) or your juggling ends and the juggled weapons fall to the ground.

subclassFeature.name: Nasty Insults
entries: Starting at 13th level, you learned to use your knowledge of people in a different way. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you targets you directly with an attack, you can use your reaction and give the creature disadvantage on the attack roll. A creature is immune to this feature if it can't hear you or if it's immune to being charmed.
You can use this feature a number this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Suprising Throws
entries: Starting at 17th level, you have advantage on any ranged weapon attack that you make using a weapon with the thrown property.

subclassFeature.name: Gambler
entries: Gamblers have the bad habit of taking risks regardless of the circumstances. However, they seem to be unbelievably lucky succeeding against even the worst of odds.

subclassFeature.name: Wager
entries: At 3rd level, you start to wager with your abilities. You can give yourself a bonus to one ability check, attack roll or saving throw you are about to make. You choose the bonus, but it can't be higher than half your proficiency bonus. When you do so, the next ability check, saving throw or attack roll you make is reduced by an amount equal to the bonus you gave yourself. You have to decide on using this feature before you roll the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Fool's Proficiency
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one other type of gaming set of your choice. You also gain proficiency in the Sleight of Hand skill or another skill of your choice from the list of skills available to rogues at 1st level, if you are already proficient in the Sleight of Hand skill.

subclassFeature.name: Lucky Seven
entries: Starting at 9th level, your luck aids you in your exploits. When you make an ability check or saving throw and roll a natural seven, you automatically succeed on the roll. In addition, when you make an attack roll and roll a natural seven, you score a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Gambler's Luck
entries: Starting at 13th level, your lucky nature can turn a failure into a success. When you make an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, you can reroll the d20 and must use the new roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficinecy bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Risky Gambit
entries: Starting at 17th level, when you deal your sneak attack damage to a creature and you roll a 1 or 2 on a sneak attack die, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or 2. When you do so, attack rolls against you have advantage until the end of your next turn.

variantrule.name: Bard Optional Features
entries: You gain class features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} when you reach certain levels in your class. This section offers additional features that you can gain as a bard. Unlike the features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, you don't gain the feature automatically. Consulting with your DM, you decide whether to gain the feature in this section if you meet the level requirement noted in the feature's description.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|BTB|bucklers} and {@item sword cane|BTB|sword canes}.

entries.name: Countercharm
entries: {@i 6th-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Countercharm feature}

Starting at 6th level, your magnificent presence disrupts mind-influencing effects. You and each creatue of your choice within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or charmed. You must be consious grant this bonusand a creature must be able to hear or see you to gain this benefit.

variantrule.name: Rogue Optional Features
entries: You gain class features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} when you reach certain levels in your class. This section offers an additionalfeature that you can gain as a rogue. Unlike the features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, you don't gain the feature automatically. Consulting with your DM, you decide whether to gain the feature in this section if you meet the level requirement noted in the feature's description.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level rogue {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|BTB|bucklers}, {@item scimitar|PHB|scimitars} and {@item sword cane|BTB|sword canes}.

variantrule.name: Monk Optional Features
entries: You gain class features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} when you reach certain levels in your class. This section offers an additionalfeature that you can gain as a monk. Unlike the features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, you don't gain the feature automatically. Consulting with your DM, you decide whether to gain the feature in this section if you meet the level requirement noted in the feature's description.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with one exotic weapon of your choice.

entries.name: Step of the Wind
entries: {@i 2nd-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Step of the Wind feature}

As a bonus action, you can take the Disengage or Dash action and your jump distance is doubled for the turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest.
Alternatively, you can expend 1 ki point to use this feature.

entries.name: Perfected Self
entries: {@i 20th-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Perfected Self feature}
At 20th level, you become a paragon of self control. Your Dexterity and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.
